alert.note: Alert for Marshall (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 30 at 5:34AM CDT until May 06 at 5:48PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Snake River below Warren affecting Marshall County. .The Snake River at Warren has seen rapid rises in river levels overnight due to continued rainfall. The river is expected to remain within Minor flood stage at this time. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Snake River below Warren. * WHEN...Until Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 71.0 feet, MODERATE FLOOD STAGE. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 69.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:45 AM CDT Saturday was 69.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 70.9 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall to 68.7 feet and begin rising again Monday morning. It will rise to 69.5 feet Tuesday evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 67.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
